text: on Lebanon's border Syria lose with
majestic beauty just behind these
snow-capped peaks unfolds madea's dark
tale Panaji left Madea with her young
family two years ago her mother nieces
nephews are still there she asked us to
blur their faces I haven't seen my
mother in a year and a half every time
we talk she breaks down in tears I'm
only asking for someone to intervene and
help the people there because what is
happening is a crime
they stay in touch by text that can't
get through today yesterday her sister
asked when is the aid coming Monday
Hannity texted just two more days of
starvation came the reply thanks be to
God these are the images said to be from
inside Medina a child whose mother says
is surviving on salt in water it's what
many seemed to be living on if you can
call this a life packets of salt handed
out leaves pulled through trees you
can't verify these images ourselves
today on the border Syrians and Lebanese
raised their voices for Madea a
rebel-held town besieged by Syria's army
and it's Lebanese Hezbollah allies
emerging from inside sia one of
mini-boss Julia 400,000 people in all
ages not getting enough attention this
is the place that used to symbolize
suffering in Syria Yarmouk we returned
to its darkest corridor last month the
UN hasn't been able to enter here since
June and some places have never been
reached today eight agencies prepared to
feed Medea and two northern villages
besieged by opposition forces
that's the deal in Syria food is a
weapon of war please to set BBC News on
the Lebanese Syrian border
